description: Number of nonnegative integer 2 X 2 matrices with no zero rows or columns and with sum of elements equal to n, up to row and column permutation.
example: There are 9 nonnegative integer 2 X 2 matrices with no zero rows or columns and with sum of elements equal to 5, up to row and column permutation:[0 1] [0 1] [0 1] [0 1] [0 2] [0 2] [0 2] [0 3] [1 1][1 3] [2 2] [3 1] [4 0] [1 2] [2 1] [3 0] [1 1] [1 2].
maple: gf := -x^2*(x^3-x^2-1)/((x^2-1)^2*(x-1)^2): s := series(gf, x, 101): for i from 2 to 100 do printf(`%d,`,coeff(s,x,i)) od:
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 28 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, May 29 2000
